clinical_study.brief_title: Overcoming Psychiatric Barriers to the Treatment of Hepatitis C
clinical_study.official_title: Overcoming Neuropsychiatric Barriers to the Treatment of Hepatitis C

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to develop and evaluate a 9-month psychosocial intervention that will assist patients with hepatitis C in overcoming barriers that prevent them from becoming appropriate candidates for interferon therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to develop and evaluate a 9-month psychosocial intervention that will assist patients with hepatitis C in overcoming barriers that prevent them from becoming appropriate candidates for interferon therapy. Patients who have been deferred from therapy due to mental health or substance abuse issues will work with the team psychologist on following through with the hepatologist's treatment recommendations that would lead to becoming eligible for interferon therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Whether or not the patient is deemed an appropriate candidate for interferon therapy at the end of the 9-month intervention.
